name: Holiday Inn Washington - Georgetown

reviews.text: Great place to stay if you are planning on visiting the Washington DC attractions. The hotel is right on the route of the Circulator Bussing system and has a stop right outside the front door. The parking is a bit pricey, but if you are a priority member then there is a discount. Enjoyed the walk to downtown Georgetown every night for dinner.
reviews.title: Would stay again!

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night with my son on his college tour trip. The hotel is pricey (not surprising given the location), but the service is solid and the room was of a good size and in pretty good condition. The hotel charges quite a lot ($30) for parking in its car park...for the price of the hotel they should include parking for free (plenty of parking is available on the nearby neighborhood streets).
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: I go to D.C. a lot, and I've stayed at quite a few hotels around the District. Most of my work is on the Hill, and the hotel shuttle was perfect to get me to the metro. I also took the shuttle to an event at American University. I had an excellent stay, and an affordable one. I encourage you to consider this hotel.
reviews.title: Will stay again

reviews.text: While the Hotel location is absolutely brilliant, and the rooms are clean and tidy, we have not had great service here. There are a couple of reasons we are rating the service as poor. Here's one. We arrived very late, after midnight, and while we paid online for the accommodation, we handed over a credit card on arrival for incidentals (although the room has no fridge or incidentals to purchase). We were woken in the morning by a call from reception to state our credit card was declined so we said we would provide another for them. An hour later, we were woken again by a knock at the door demanding we go downstairs with a cc. We refused and went back to sleep. A few hours later, we were working in the room, and we received another call. This time I was awake enough to exclaim that the room was paid for and I didn't see why they were so concerned that they had to hound us. We then went down to reception and gave them an alternative card, but we received no apology for the drama.
reviews.title: Worst service we have had in the States

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drag hotel, poor service, $30 a night to park in a parking lot, not valet, just ordinary garden variety parking lot. Filter in heating unit so dirty we couldnt turn on the heat because it stank so bad. bath didnt drain, cheap construction - you can hear everything going on in the hallways and other rooms. This is NOT Georgetown, it's 18 blocks from Georgetown. takes 25 min bus ride (plus 1/3mile walk) to get to closest metro. Front desk service was poorest I've seen in some time (travel a lot on business). Restaurant waay overpriced. Trust me, you can do so much better for the money, and stay someplace convenient, pleasant, clean, well-staffed.
reviews.title: Stay away: centrally located to nowhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Holiday Inn from 12/28/2011 to 12/31/2011. We had a king-bed room. It was pretty clean, had a nice sized bathroom, flat screen TV, nicely furnished, and reasonable.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. The only downside to our room was the tub---the lever you pull to get the water to come the shower head instead of the faucet was impossibly hard to pull up..something was wrong with it. We had a view of the Washington Monument...however our window seal was broken so the window was "fogged" so you couldn't see out half the window.
reviews.title: Improvement needed

reviews.text: I have stayed in this holiday inn couple of times as it is very close to embassies. I come to DC multiple times and I always regret staying there within a day. This place is marginally clean, the people are not so cheerful. I feel so dull when i walk in here. The rooms are so dark and don't get so much lighting, it makes me feel like being in cell for me!
reviews.title: Worst hotel in DC

reviews.text: The good things about this place is the location and shuttle service. However, I am still willing to stay a bit farther away and pay for taxi than staying here. My pet peeve about this place is coffee maker in bathroom. 1. It is not hygenic at all (There is a damn toilet there, think about it people!) 2. Coffee maker looked as though it hasn't been cleaned for ages. The moment i saw that, i decided to check out and moved to another HI location in couple of miles away. I still enjoy being in IHG properties but this one is not for me.
reviews.title: Still great value, but....

reviews.text: After pulling up at the hotel entrance to help my father check in and see him to his room, I returned to my car to find a $250.00 ticket. It was Christmas night and there was no one around . When I inquired about the ticket and apologized for leaving my car for the few minutes it took to drop my dad off, I was met with complete indifference and an obnoxious attitude from the front desk clerk. The room door was also strangely ajar when we arrived at the room and the room was marginally clean. The staff was rude and aggressive! Will never stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Georgetown for the Price

reviews.text: We stayed at this Holiday Inn the first week of March. It is a bland Holiday Inn with drab 70's decor, saggy mattresses and absolutely nothing that would bring us back. The "business center" was a complete joke. It was a phone booth sized space in the lobby with no seating or privacy. It required a credit card to use the computer. Yes, the first 15 minutes of computer time per 24 hours was free, but that is not what we have come to expect in a hotel business center. The hotel location is just OK at the far end of Wisconsin Ave. It is a $15+ cab ride to most of the main DC attractions. There is no subway stop near by. The restaurant/bar on site is John F's. It is expensive and the bar is closed by 9 p.m. The rooms were clean but it's time for an upgrade to this property as it is well past its prime. A proper business center is a necessity.
reviews.title: Drab, dull . . . . oh, it's a Holiday Inn

reviews.text: The room was not clean. There were spots on the mirror in the bathroom that should have been wiped. The same with the bathtub. I tried to connect my phone charger to an outlet behind a chair, and there was accumulated dust that had not been taken care of in a long time. Then I surveyed the room more carefully and there was dust in every corner. The same with the two chairs by the round table. They have not been vacuumed in a long time. Again, in the corners where the seat meets the back of the chair.
reviews.title: The room was not clean.

reviews.text: We just needed a place to sleep since we were arriving late Friday night and leaving early in the morning for some college tours. But we wanted to be close to where we were going. I called only a few days before our arrival and actually got a better rate than what was published online, but had to agree that it would be non-refundable. I was fine with that. Since I am a Priority Club member, I also got a discount on parking from $30 to $15, which was great. The Front Desk staff was friendly, it was after 11pm, and we were very tired, she took care of us quickly which we appreciated. We also left the car till about 4pm Saturday with no problem.
reviews.title: Centrally Located

reviews.text: The room was fine, though the desk was missing, which we didn't care about and it actually made the room seem larger. We had free WiFi, also a bonus, which my kids took advantage of.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY!!!!

reviews.text: We inquired about getting a cab in the morning, and they told us they run a shuttle to the University, you just have to come down to the lobby 15 minutes before you want to leave. So, we headed down at 9am, to be told that it would be 30 minutes because one had just left. Well, that didn't work for us, so we took a cab, which cost $15 to American University.
reviews.title: Decent Accomodations - Useful Location
Much better than "reviewed" about
reviews.text: After all the reviews, I booked this hotel with a cringe and a prayer. The city was sold out so I had no other choice.

It's actually not as bad as everyone states. I made sure that I was booking a non-smoking room for no surprises, everything is as a Holiday Inn level should be expected. Upon arrival the scent of the Holiday Inn is quite welcoming and lovely. I am very happy with my non-smoking floor and clean room. Absolutely NO complaints with cleanliness of room. Service has been great from all the persons I've met. Street is quiet at night.
reviews.title: Worst customer service

reviews.text: The Walk to M street is a bit of a hike so don't expect it to be right around the corner. That said, I am enjoying being in the area that's safe at night and walkable since I didn't rent a car.
reviews.title: Is this the worst (and dirtiest) hotel in the US? We think so!

reviews.text: I could see myself staying here again just for the surrounding area.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: I recently travelled to Georgetown on business. Although I love the area, I had a horrible experience with customer service from the moment I walked in. Long story short, they misplaced paperwork my company had sent over to authorize payment of my stay on the company card. Coincidentally, another woman was in the same pdicament at the same time. This resulted in an hour check in delay. Someone from my office offered her personal card for one night however they charged the entire stay to her card and to the company card. They end up crediting my card for the stay which was never charged. Its been 2 weeks since my visit and its still not resolved. Ive sent 2 emails to the general manager and there has been no reply. Corporate has not yet responded. They employ young men at the front desk who are flirty with the women patrons but who are ultimately responsible for the disaster which happened. I will say that the locaion is great and the bar staff are very kind and helpful.
reviews.title: Georgetown Holiday Veteran

aka: Holiday Inn Washington - Georgetown Hotel Washington Dc
description: Located in the heart of historic Georgetown, the Holiday Inn Washington, DC -Georgetown is the perfect hotel for business and leisure travelers. The Holiday Inn Washington, DC-Georgetown hotel boasts an upscale traditional dÃ©cor and includes free high-speed Internet access throughout the hotel.Our centralized location is surrounded by fine restaurants and specialty boutiques. We offer free shuttle service with stops at Wisconsin and M Streets NW, Georgetown Medical Center, Georgetown University, Embassies, American University and Woodley Park Metro. Coupled with the nearby Red Line Metro, you will have easy access to all of Washington DC s area attractions, such as the White House, National Zoo, Smithsonian museums, and Washington Monument. The Circulator Bus Line stops at the hotel providing easy access to the National Mall, downtown and Union Stations for only $1.Stay productive in our 24-hour business center, maintain your exercise regimen in our state-of-the-art aerobic fitness center or relax and enjoy the ambiance of Happy Hour in John F s Lounge and dinner in John F s Market CafÃ© where kids under 12 eat free! Come enjoy the Holiday Inn Washington, DC-Georgetown Hotel when visiting Washington, DC. We have all the elements for creating an exciting experience.
